diseases.name: Tea Mosquito Bug
symptoms: Feeding causes necrotic spots on young shoots, leaves, and nuts.
treatment: Apply Neem-based insecticides or chemical pesticides like Imidacloprid (0.3ml/L).
Encourage natural predators like ladybugs and spiders.
Prune infested branches to reduce bug populations.

diseases.name: Cashew Stem and Root Borer
symptoms: Larvae bore into the trunk and roots, causing tree weakening.
Wilting of leaves and eventual tree death.
treatment: Apply Chlorpyrifos (5ml/L) or Neem oil to affected areas.
Remove and destroy heavily infested trees.
Paint tree trunks with lime and Bordeaux mixture as a preventive measure.

diseases.name: Thrips
symptoms: Silvering and curling of young leaves.
Infested nuts turn brown and fall prematurely.
treatment: Use Biological control agents like predatory mites.
Spray with Spinosad (0.5ml/L) or Neem extract.
Maintain good orchard sanitation.

diseases.name: Sunscald or Heat Stress
symptoms: Sunburn on exposed stems and nuts.
treatment: Provide shade trees or apply whitewash to exposed stems.
Maintain proper irrigation during hot months.

diseases.name: Drought Stress
symptoms: Wilting, reduced nut size, and delayed flowering.
treatment: Implement drip irrigation for consistent moisture.
Mulch around trees to retain soil moisture.

diseases.name: Zinc Deficiency
symptoms: Small leaves, yellowing, and reduced nut development.
treatment: Foliar spray with Zinc Sulphate (0.5%).

diseases.name: Boron Deficiency
symptoms: Poor flowering, hollow nuts, and dieback.
treatment: Apply Boron (1-2g/L) as foliar spray during flowering.

diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
symptoms: White powdery patches on leaves, flowers, and young nuts.
Causes flower abortion and reduced fruit set.
treatment: Apply Sulfur-based fungicides or wettable sulfur (2g/L).
Spray Copper-based fungicides before flowering.

diseases.name: Anthracnose
symptoms: Black sunken spots on leaves, shoots, and nuts.
treatment: Use Copper Oxychloride (2g/L) as a preventive spray.
Ensure proper spacing for airflow to reduce humidity.

diseases.name: Dieback
symptoms: Progressive drying of branches from tip to base.
Dark lesions on stems and leaves.
treatment: Prune affected branches and apply Copper-based fungicides.
Improve soil drainage and avoid waterlogging.

general_recommendations.title: Integrated Pest Management (IPM)
general_recommendations.details: Use a combination of biological control, organic pesticides, and cultural practices.

general_recommendations.title: Regular Orchard Monitoring
general_recommendations.details: Conduct weekly inspections for early disease or pest detection.

general_recommendations.title: Proper Sanitation
general_recommendations.details: Remove diseased plant material and weeds to reduce infection spread.

general_recommendations.title: Balanced Fertilization
general_recommendations.details: Apply NPK fertilizers in appropriate doses to maintain tree health.
